column4: does ssh need to be configured or anything to log in? the 22 port works ok and asks for login but root and its pass won't work...
severian, i did sudo passwd root and defined a root with which i'm logged in now
i'm using the base install
even if u changed the root passwd, ubuntu configured sshd NOT to accept direct root logins
how can change that? in etc/ssh/sshd_config ?
yes but that will definately defeat the purpose of having a secure configurations now would it :)
i did make another username during the install, a non-root one but that isn't working either
any chances that u forgot the password?
then what was it that doest work? su ?
logging in remotely to the box from putty in windows doesn't work
u can connect via putty but u cant login ?
exactly
try changing the password at the box itself then try loggin via putty again
i'll try it
i just keep getting access denied, must be something in the config....
you could check it if you think that could be the problem :D
problem is i am behind a VOIP router and on a wifi access-point (well router with DHCP turned off) connected to the VOIP router
that shouldnt be a problem coz u can connect to the box
i'll pkill sshd and play with its config then start it again. but at least i know it is working
ok i was wrong....i stopped it, its not in ps -A and i got the login again...so i guess i was SSHing into something else...but what?
beats me.. sshd gone haywire for a while i guessd :p
